oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Margaret Wright, 1976 August 30, excerpt 02
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Margaret Wright, conducted on 30 August 1976 by Ann Wells as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Tennessee Centennial Project. Wright describes the music, fireworks, lake, and gondoliers at the Centennial. She also describes the area of the Centennial called the Blue Grotto. The complete interview is available in the Special Collections Division.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wright, Margaret Fall, 1887-1985--Interviews
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)
